page.title: 06Industry
page.content: The 4 villages all have small industrial estates.The largest, at Cryer's Hill,is on the site of the old saw mills.Small units still retain the link with timber by manufacturing fencing and sheds and providing tree surgery services. A roofing specialist,a tool-hire firm,a motor-body repair workshop and parking for local coach firms take up much space. Newer technology has found a home here in a laser scanning and litho reproduction works and Microserve Electrons,with only 4 workers,is one of the two companies in the country which make electrical controls and monitoring systems for electric cars and also produces equipment for automated guided vehicles used in warehouses. Moulds for the plastics industry are made in Naphill.
